get.summary: Read existing Multicast Source Discovery Protocol configurations
get.description:
Multicast Source Discovery Protocol Router configurations.
When MSDP is configured in a network, Rendezvous Points(RP) running MSDP
exchange source information with MSDP enabled RPs in other domains. An RP
can join the interdomain source tree for sources that are sending to groups
for which it has multicast receivers.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaMsdp_MsdpSchema.description:
Multicast Source Discovery Protocol Router configurations.
When MSDP is configured in a network, Rendezvous Points(RP) running MSDP
exchange source information with MSDP enabled RPs in other domains. An RP
can join the interdomain source tree for sources that are sending to groups
for which it has multicast receivers.

router.description: The list of all the MSDP Router instances

vrf.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.

sa-interval.description:
Source Active Interval Frequency at which
MSDP Source Active messages are sent

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

router.description: The list of all the MSDP Router instances

vrf.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.

sa-interval.description:
Source Active Interval Frequency at which
MSDP Source Active messages are sent

address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
address.description: IP address of the MSDP Peer

tcp-connection-source-interface-type.description: Interface type to be used for communication to the peer

loopback-tcp-connection-source.description: Loopback interface name to be used for communication to the peer.

sub-interface-tcp-connection-source.description: L3 subinterface name to be used for communication to the peer.

svi-tcp-connection-source.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
svi-tcp-connection-source.description: L3 SVI id to be used for communication to the peer.

eth-tcp-connection-source.description: Ethernet Interface to be used for communication to the peer.

lag-tcp-connection-source.description: LAG Interface to be used for communication to the peer.

sa-limit.description:
A limit on the number of Source Active entries
accepted from the peer

mesh-group.description:
Name of the mesh group if MSDP peer is configured
as part of a mesh group

sa-filter-in.description:
Ingress ACL to filter processing of MSDP Source
Active messages received from peer

sa-filter-out.description:
Egress ACL to filter MSDP Source Active messages
sent to peer

keepalive-interval.description:
Interval at which keepalive messages are sent
to the MSDP peer

holdtime-interval.description:
Time for which MSDP will wait for keepalive
messages from peer before declaring it down

connect-retry-interval.description:
Maximum time the peer will wait before attempting
to reestablish the TCP connection when connection
reset happens

password-key.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
